page.title: 13A VIEW ACROSS THE ARUN GAP
page.content: A pleasant scene greets the eye of the beholder as he stands near North Stoke Church looking West. Coniferous woods crown the higher slopes of Arundel Park which fall steeply down to the river Arun. Deciduous woods edge the long curve of the river. In the Park stretches of turf are interspersed with small patches of cultivation grown as cover for pheasants, and a pleasant path follows the course of the river. Occasional glimpses can be had of old chalk pits. On the east of the river the flat meadows of the valley provide grazing for cattle, and the Georgian farmhouse and outbuildings cluster on higher ground near the church. The road from Houghton Bridge peters out here for this is a cul-de-sac village.
